item.description:
Free kids’ workshops will be given between games; Tom Nenortas of the Hartford Preservation Alliance will provide a historical overview of Coltsville and the Potsdam Village houses that can be seen from the Meadows; the authors of the newly-released “The T206 Collection: The Players and Their Stories” will be on hand selling autographed copies of their book; Erik Miklich of 19cbaseball.com will be selling base balls, the Lawson card game and other items. There wil be other vendors there as well and the ever-popular Handlebar Hooch, Dead Red and Pops’ Pop vintage soda will be available for purchase. On Saturday, Ron Bolin, an Education Ambassador for the National Baseball Hall of Fame in Cooperstown, NY will appear as Babe Ruth with free giveaways for kids. And on Sunday, Mark Twain will make an appearance and even toss out the first pitch!

The event, made possible in part by the Greater Hartford Arts Council, begins at 11:00am both days, is free and family-friendly. Attendees are invited to bring lawn chairs, blankets, a picnic lunch and sunscreen and enjoy the bucolic atmosphere of Colt Meadows.
item.name: 19 Century Period Baseball- Colt Park - Hartford CT
